actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Social Security.

official_title: To amend title II of the Social Security Act to restore the pre-1981 provisions for determining the order of payment of lump-sum death benefits.
short_title: Social Security Lump-Sum Death Benefits Act of 1991
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Social Security Lump-Sum Death Benefits Act of 1991 - Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to permit the payment of lump-sum death benefits for burial expenses in the case of an insured individual who has no surviving spouse living in the same household at the time of his or her death. (Currently, the payment of lump-sum death benefits in such a case is restricted to a widow or widower entitled to benefits on the basis of the insured's wages and self-employment income or a child so entitled.)

titles.title: Social Security Lump-Sum Death Benefits Act of 1991
To amend title II of the Social Security Act to restore the pre-1981 provisions for determining the order of payment of lump-sum death benefits.
